title: Wilbur Harden / John Coltrane - Jazz Way Out 1958 [Savoy]
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jazz Way OutÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is the second of the three Savoy 1958 straight-ahead, hard bop recordings made by Wilbur Harden with John Coltrane. Harden was one of the first trumpeters in Jazz to regularly double on flugelhorn. On this session they are joined by Curtis Fuller on Trombone.
 
Wilbur Harden is a mystery man in jazz history, for he appeared on some important recording sessions - most notably with John Coltrane in 1958 on Ã¢â‚¬Å“StardustÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Standard ColtraneÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“BahiaÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ - and then, after 1960, pretty well disappeared. 

After playing R&B with Roy Brown and Ivory Joe Hunter, Harden emerged in 1957, recording with Yusef Lateef, and led four record dates for Savoy in 1958; three were with Coltrane Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Mainstream 1958Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jazz Way OutÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Tanganyika StrutÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ - and one, Ã¢â‚¬Å“The King and IÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, in a quartet with Tommy Flanagan.

In late 1958 Harden fell seriously ill, spending four whole years under medical care. His last recording session took place in 1960 with Curtis Fuller's group, following a brief release from the hospital. After that, he quit playing and died in 1969 in New York.
